page.title: 07St. James' Church
page.content: .Because the hard had been built for the fishermen they wanted to live nearby but around 1800 the houses and streets started to spread and so the population grew.Until this time the people had worshipped at{All Saints {Church}which is a mile and a quarter from the town on the only road into town. There were no cars and it was a long way to walk to church.In 1836 a {Chapel of Ease}was built in the High Street with the growing village around it.Over the years many things were added to it, the Pews being made in the shipyard. The gallery was later added so that now,{St. James Church}as it now is, can seat about one hundred more people than All Saints Church. All Saints is still used particularly for special occasions.
